p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: center;
p.seg: APPLICATION TO BRING LANDS UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE REAL PROPERTY ACT OF 1861

div.p:
I Ferdinand Jacob Heinrich Müller of Melbourne in the province of Victoria Phil & Med. Dr, Government botanist do declare that I am seised of an estate of freehold in fee simple in all that piece of land situated in the Hundred of Macclesfield, County of Hindmarsh, containing twenty acres one rood and two perches, be the same little more or less, bounded on the Westside by other portion of the same Section, on the Northside by Section 2831, on the South and East by Government roads, as the same is more particularly described and delineated in the plan drawn in the margin hereof.
62-06-28a_image01.jpg

which piece of land is of the value of One Hundred Pounds Sterling and no more, and is portion of Section of land originally granted to Samuel Davenport by land grant, under the hand and seal of Sir Henry Edward Fox Young, formerly Governor of the Province of South Australia, dated the 23rd day of April 1849, numbered 2852 in the plan of the Hundreds of Macclesfield & Strathalbyn as delineated on the public maps of the Province deposited in the Survey Office in Adelaide: And I do further declare that I am not aware of any mortgage, encumbrance, or claim affecting the said lands, or that any person hath any claim, estate, or interest in the said lands at law or in equity, in possession or in expectancy, other than is set forth and stated as follows, that is to say — That I have agreed to convey upon trust half an acre of land, situated in the Northeastern corner of the said piece of land, for the purpose of erecting a public schoolhouse thereon

And I further declare there is no person in possession or occupation of the said lands adversely to my estate or interest therein, and that the said land is now in the occupation of Fritz Fischer and that Samuel Davenport of Beaumont and Richard Cornelius of Mount Barker are owners and James Enwright and Heinrich Niewand are occupiers of contiguous land and that there are no deeds or instruments of title affecting such land in my possession or under my control, other than those enumerated in the Schedule hereto: And I made this solemn declaration, conscientiously believing the same to be true.
Dated at Melbourne this twenty eight day of June 1862.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Ferd. Mueller
Made and subscribed by the above-named Ferdinand Mueller this twenty eighth day of June 1862 in the presence of me

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: William F. Stawell

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Colony of Victoria
I, Ferdinand Jacob Heinrich Müller the above declarant, do hereby apply to have the piece of land described in the above declaration brought under the provisions of the Real Property Act of 1861.
Dated at Melbourne this twenty eight day of June 1862.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Ferd. Mueller

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: William F. Stawell

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Colony of Victoria

I, the above-named declarant, hereby request you to issue the Certificate of Title for the above-mentioned piece of land , coloured blue , containing 19a 3r. 3p. be the same little more or less, in the name of Ferdinand Jacob Heinrich Müller of Melbourne in the province of Victoria Phil. & Med Dr Government botanist; and for the piece of land coloured red in the name of the District Council of Macclesfield

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. Mueller
Marginal annotation: ‘Certificate issued to Dist Council of Macclesfield V.XXXIII Folio 124 23/9/62 & to F. J. H. Müller Vol. XXXIII F. 167 29/9/62.’ See also Transfer of Title, 15 December 1865 (in this edition as 65-12-15a).

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: William F. Stawell

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the Colony of Victoria

seg.seg: [This application is correct for the purposes of the Real Property Act.]

div.p: F. E. Krichauff
Lic. Land Broker

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: center;

div.p: Conveyance Samuel Davenport to F. J. H. Müller dated 9th Nov. 1850.
